com.nttdocomo.ui
Class ListBox

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Component
        |
        +--com.nttdocomo.ui.ListBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
Interactable
public final class ListBox
extends Component
implements Interactable

This is a list box component class.
This is one of the UI components used in high level API and a component indicating a selection list, check box and radio button.
The following lists can be created by designating the list type using a constructor argument.

  • Option menu
  • Single select list
  • Multiple select list
  • Radio button list
  • Check box list
  • Numbered list
These can be compiled as follows from the prospective of format and selection. 
 

 

 
List TypeSelection

 
Single selectionMultiple selection

 
Pop-up selectionOption Menu
(CHOICE)		None

 
Field TypeList	Single select list
(SINGLE_SELECT)		
 Multiple select list
(MULTIPLE_SELECT)

 
Numbered listNumbered list
(NUMBERED_LIST)		None

 
CheckboxNoneCheckbox list
(CHECK_BOX)

 
Radio buttonRadio button list
(RADIO_BUTTON)		None
The option menu is equivalent to the menu when the size is not designated with the SELECT tag of CHTML. Usually, the selected item is displayed and the items in the list are expanded and displayed when the corresponding list component is selected. 
   +-----------+          +-----------+
   | item1     |  ---->   |item1      |
   +-----------+  <----   |item2      |
                          |item3      |
                          +-----------+
The height of the expanded menu is the shorter of the height to display all the stored items or the height of the screen. Therefore, when there are many items, the number of items to be shown in an expanded display at once is limited. However, hidden items can be seen by scrolling. The width of the expanded menu is implementation-dependent.

Field format lists are boxed scrolled lists. When size is not designated, the width of this format of list is the same as the panel width and the height of the list is the shorter of the height required to display all the stored items or the height of the screen. In addition, when the number of lines are designated, the height is the shorter of the height required to display all the number of lines or the screen height. When 0 is set for the number of lines, it is regarded as being set to 1 instead. When there are too many items to display all at once, the hidden items can be seen by scrolling. The following are display examples. 

   +------------+    +------------+    +------------+     +------------+    
   |item1       |    |1. item1    |    |Åõ item1    |     |Å† item1    |
   |item2       |    |2. item2    |    |Åõ item2    |     |Å° item2    |
   |item3       |    |3. item3    |    |Åù item3    |     |Å† item3    |
   |item4       |    |4. item4    |    |Åõ item4    |     |Å† item4    |
   |item5       |    |5. item5    |    |Åõ item5    |     |Å° item5    |
   +------------+    +------------+    +------------+     +------------+
The numbered list is a special version of the single select list and the top nine items can be selected using numeric keys. It can be set so that the top item corresponds to key 1, the second item to key 2, and the ninth to key 9, etc. The tenth and later items cannot have corresponding numeric keys established. When selecting one of these later keys, do so in the same method as the single select list operation.
The character string of the item to be set is one line. When the character string of the item to be set is wider than the component width, the excess shall be cut off and not shown.
When there are too many items to display all at once at the designated size, the hidden items can be seen by scrolling.
In the list index, 0 is designated for the top item and 1 for the second item and on.

          A numbered list in which in numbers are allocated for each item and pressing the numeric key corresponding to the item number directly selects the item (=3).

          This is a radio button for selecting only one item exclusively from among multiple items (=1).

Constructor Detail

ListBox

public ListBox(int type)
This creates an empty list box without items. When created, it is visible and user-operable. To set visible or invisible, the setVisible method is used. To set user-operable or use-inoperable, the setEnabled method is used.

Parameters:
type - Designates the list box type. For type, one of SINGLE_SELECT, RADIO_BUTTON, CHECK_BOX, NUMBERD_LIST, MULTIPLE_SELECT and CHOICE can be designated. An exception is generated when a value other than the above is designated.
Throws:
IllealArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is designated for the argument type.

ListBox

public ListBox(int type,
               int rows)
This creates an empty list box without items. When created, it is visible and user-operable. To set visible or invisible, the setVisible method is used. To set user-operable or user-inoperable, the setEnabled method is used.

Parameters:
type - Designates the list box type. For type, one of SINGLE_SELECT, RADIO_BUTTON, CHECK_BOX, NUMBERD_LIST, MULTIPLE_SELECT and CHOICE can be designated. An exception is generated when a value other than the above is designated.
rows - Designates the number of lines to be displayed. This parameter is valid only when the type is other than CHOICE. When 0 is designated, it behaves as if 1 is designated.
Throws:
IllealArgumentException - Generated when an illegal value is designated for the argument type and when a value less than 0 is designated for the argument rows.
Method Detail

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean b)
This sets the list box to be user-operable or user-inoperable. It is user-operable in default.

Specified by:
setEnabled in interface Interactable
Parameters:
b - Designates true to be user-operable or false to be user-inoperable.

requestFocus

public void requestFocus()
This requests that the list box be put in focus. The requests before the list box has been added to the panel via the add method are ignored. When it is user-inoperable, focus requests made via requestFocus() shall not be accepted.

Specified by:
requestFocus in interface Interactable

setItems

public void setItems(java.lang.String[] items)
This complies list items and arranges an array. All the items before that are deleted and all the items of the designated array are newly set.
This method functions whether or not it is user-operable.

Parameters:
items - Designates the items to be added. NullPointerException is generated when null is designated.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the argument items or when null is designated for the elements of the argument items.

append

public void append(java.lang.String item)
This adds new items to the end of the list. This method functions whether or not it is user-operable.

Parameters:
item - Designates the items to be added
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - Generated when null is designated for the argument item.

removeAll

public void removeAll()
This deletes all the items on the list. This method functions whether or not it is user-operable.

getItemCount

public int getItemCount()
This obtains the number of the items on the list.

Returns:
The number of items on the list.

getItem

public java.lang.String getItem(int index)
This obtains the items at a certain location on the list.

Parameters:
index - This designates the location of the item to be obtained.
Returns:
It shall return the item of the designated location.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - -Generated when a negative value or a value larger than the number of items is designated for the argument index.

select

public void select(int index)
This selects an item at a certain location of the list. When the item is at a location that is not displayed, scroll until the location appears. When selecting the item, a component event (SELECTION_CHANGED) shall be generated in line with the list box type.

Whether or not it is visible, the selection status changes by calling this method. However, this event generated only when it is visible.
This method functions whether or not it is user-operable.

Parameters:
index - Designates the location of the item to be selected.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - Generated when a negative value or a value larger than the number of items is designated for the argument index.

deselect

public void deselect(int index)
This deselects an item at a certain location of the list. When deselecting an item, a component event (SELECTION_CHANGED) is generated in line with the list box type.
Whether or not it is visible, the selection status changes by calling this method. However, this event generated only when it is visible.
This method functions whether or not it is user-operable.

Parameters:
index - Designates the location of the item to be deselected.
Throws:
UIException - Generated when called for CHOICE type list box (ILLEGAL_STATE).
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - Generated when a negative value or a value larger than the number of items is designated for the argument index.

isIndexSelected

public boolean isIndexSelected(int index)
This checks whether an item at a certain location of the list is selected.

Parameters:
index - Designates the location of the item to be checked for whether or not it is selected
Returns:
This shall return true when the item is selected and false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - Generated when a negative value or a value larger than the number of items is designated for the argument index.

getSelectedIndex

public int getSelectedIndex()
The location of the selected item. When multiple items are selected, it returns the location of the item whose location value is the smallest.

Returns:
The location of the selected item. When no item is selected, -1 is returned.
